result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Plea/sentencing hearing on November 9, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Plea Agreement

Activity: Calendar call 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

11:25 AM  Defendant Christopher Steven Grider not in court.  Attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz appeared by video for Christopher Steven Grider.  Prosecuting attorney Mason C Braunschweig in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant transported to prison.  Attorney Lochowicz to prepare writ if needed.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Calendar call on August 25, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Initial Scheduling Order

Activity:  Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

01:50 PM Defendant Christopher Steven Grider in court in custody by video from the Rock County Jail with attorney Bradley J. Lochowicz by video.  Mason C Braunschweig appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives preliminary hearing freely and voluntarily.  Court accepts waiver and binds the Defendant over for the filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and jury trial to be set.  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing on April 25, 2022 at 01:45 pm.

03:12 PM Defendant Christopher Steven Grider in court by video in custody with attorney Shanna Knueppel by video .  Mason C Braunschweig and Margaret Ginocchio appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived. No contact with any minors whatsoever. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom.
